comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Now Lang Park. the actual tunnel they are building appears to be on a curve to the east, so probably the tunnel that lead to Circular Quay, built the same time (but not opened) as the ones to the Harbour Bridge.

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/63385174@N06] My guess is that the tunnel turning toward circular quay is much deeper especially to control the appropriate downward gradient.
There is another later photo from the other direction showing how shallow the top underground platform for the North Shore line is below the road.
Also the description "Southern approach" supports this.
